content.description: Low-ish start with left hand on an undercling and right hand in a shallow pocket. Go up and direct through a pocket, a good crimp, then to the lip. A nice overhang with sustained, hard moves. Good luck keeping your feet from cutting.
content.location: Follow the stream down and south, past the Purple Pyramid boulder for a few minutes. This is an obvious line that goes up the center of the boulder. The Whirlpool area appears to be named in reference to the sandy landing spot, surrounded by a low, rounded rock feature that looks like it was eroded by a body of rotating water produced by opposing currents.

content.description: Stand start with right hand in a three finger pocket, and the left on a mono pinch, then make your way up the boulder and top out
content.location: Toward the right of the south face of the boulder tagged sponge, by the water

content.description: One of the very best boulder problems in the Santa Monica mountains, this gem is going to delight or torment you. Follow a band of pockets and knobs up to a sloping topout that feels taller than it really is. Awesome movement on amazing stone with slick, polished footholds. Â This one will stay in your mind long after you do it. The landing area varies from nice sand & gravel, to a pool of swampy water, from year to year.
content.location: Located on a separate formation about 70 yards downstream from Whirlpool area on the opposite side of the creek. It faces the far side of the stream eastward.
